subject: Music
title: How Opera Works
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Opera Works.

hook.text: Opera combines singing, acting, orchestral music, and visual spectacle into one art form.

buildup.text: The libretto provides the story, arias express emotions, and recitatives advance the plot.

discovery.text: Opera singers train for years to project their voices over a full orchestra without microphones.

twist.text: The best opera arias are so emotionally powerful you don't need to understand the language.

climax.text: From Verdi to Puccini, opera became the most emotionally intense art form in history.

punchline.text: You don't need to speak Italian. The music translates everything.

quiz.question: What is a libretto in opera?
options: The text or story of an opera
